results.title: Australian diary. No. 056
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: Army tradesmen have their passing out ceremony; the cultivation of wildflowers for the export market; the Australian cheese industry is becoming an important asset; migrant children learn Australian games and the spotlight is on the newly developed tuna fishing industry.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 055
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: Australia’s defence plants including Maribyrnong and Fishermen’s Bend ordanance factories, are busy; training gun dogs takes patience; Ghost town, Hill End, puts the clock back 100 years; surfing is Sydney’s favourite summer pastime.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 053
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: ugly crocodile hides become things of beauty; timber is a big industry in Western Australia; the tobacco industry in Western Australia is examined and the “Tour of the West” a gruelling cycling marathon is shown.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 051
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: the whaling season is in fuu swing in Western Australia; the inauguration of the Melbourne-Christchurch air service between Australia and New Zealand; machines take over the tapestry workers’ art and cattle judges have decisions put to the test at Sydney Fat Stock Show.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 050
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a self-taught sculptor makes Aborigines the subject of his work; a Child Welfare Centre is a boon in New Guinea; plastic bowls show they run true to form and a history of duelling through the ages is shown.
